The first step is to understand what each curve represents. From Document [8], we learn that the Curve of Spee is defined as the curvature of the mandibular occlusal plane beginning at the canine and following the buccal cusps of the posterior teeth, continuing to the terminal molar. Document [6] mentions the Curve of Wilson as the coronal occlusal curve in the posterior dentition. Document [28] describes the Curve of Monson as an extension of the Curve of Spee while maintaining its arc into a circle centered at the glabella. The Catenary curve is not mentioned in the documents, so we can't gather information about it from the provided sources. Given the question asks about the curve touching the buccal and lingual surfaces of mandibular buccal cuspal teeth, the Curve of Wilson seems to be the most relevant as it is described as the coronal occlusal curve in the posterior dentition, which would include both buccal and lingual surfaces.
